content: The "Taxpayer Debt Buy-Down Act" designates amounts for the reduction of public debt under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It introduces a new part for the designation of funds towards reducing public debt. The "Taxpayer Debt Buy-Down Act" allows individuals to designate up to 10% of their adjusted income tax liability to reduce public debt. This designation must be made when filing tax returns and is separate from any contributions to the Presidential Election Campaign Fund. The "Taxpayer Debt Buy-Down Act" allows individuals to designate up to 10% of their adjusted income tax liability to reduce public debt for taxable years ending after the enactment of the Act.
